availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Knott (Jefferson County, KY, clerk and flour dealer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and flour dealer. Kentucky native. Married to Isabella A Conner Knott in Jefferson County on January 16, 1854. Clerk for G. R. Knott and Brothers grocer in 1859. Signed a petition as a flour dealer in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector. Clerk in Hamilton County, Ohio in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 6, p. 296.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 08, p. 279A.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 133.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482708, p. 61.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, First Congressional District, Eastern part of Hamilton County, Ohio, June 1863, p. 316, (Accessed via ancestry.com on January 23, 2020).
KYR-0001-017-0163.
